metadata.description: Files may contain hardcoded sensitive information like usernames, passwords, keys, etc.
The App uses an insecure Random Number Generator (java.util.Random) which produces a predictable sequence of numbers.

manifest_analysis.title: Application is debuggable
manifest_analysis.description: The android:debuggable flag is set to true in the AndroidManifest.xml. Debuggable applications can be attached to a debugger at runtime, allowing inspection of the application state and extraction of sensitive data.

manifest_analysis.title: Application allows backup
manifest_analysis.description: The android:allowBackup flag is set to true. This allows the application data to be backed up via adb, potentially exposing sensitive information stored locally.

binary_analysis.title: Binary makes use of insecure API(s)
binary_analysis.description: The binary may contain the following insecure API(s): _memcpy, _strlen. These APIs are known to have buffer overflow vulnerabilities and should be replaced with safer alternatives.
binary_analysis.name: lib/armeabi-v7a/libnative.so

certificate_findings.title: Application is signed with a debug certificate
certificate_findings.description: The application is signed with a debug certificate. Debug certificates should never be used for production releases as they indicate a development build.
